{{Big Brother endgame | hmpage = Housemates | seriesname = Big Brother Brasil | previous = Big Brother Brasil 3 | next = Big Brother Brasil 5 | series = Season 4 (2004) | image = | imagebg = #000 | start = January 13, 2004 | end = April 6, 2004 | hm1 = Cida | hm1-enter = Day 3 | hm1-exit = Day 85 | hm1-stat = winner | hm2 = Thiago | hm2-enter = Day 3 | hm2-exit = Day 85 | hm2-stat = runner | hm3 = Juliana | hm3-enter = Day 1 | hm3-exit = Day 83 | hm3-stat = evic | hm4 = Solange | hm4-enter = Day 1 | hm4-exit = Day 78 | hm4-stat = evic | hm5 = Marcela | hm5-enter = Day 1 | hm5-exit = Day 71 | hm5-stat = evic | hm6 = Rogerio | hm6-enter = Day 1 | hm6-exit = Day 64 | hm6-stat = evic | hm7 = Marcelo | hm7-enter = Day 1 | hm7-exit = Day 57 | hm7-stat = evic | hm8 = Zulu | hm8-enter = Day 1 | hm8-exit = Day 50 | hm8-stat = evic | hm9 = Buba | hm9-enter = Day 1 | hm9-exit = Day 43 | hm9-stat = evic | hm10 = GÃ©ris | hm10-enter = Day 1 | hm10-exit = Day 36 | hm10-stat = evic | hm11 = Antonella | hm11-enter = Day 1 | hm11-exit = Day 29 | hm11-stat = evic | hm12 = Cristiano | hm12-enter = Day 1 | hm12-exit = Day 22 | hm12-stat = five | hm13 = Eduardo | hm13-enter = Day 1 | hm13-exit = Day 15 | hm13-stat = evic | hm14 = Tatiana | hm14-enter = Day 1 | hm14-exit = Day 8 | hm14-stat = evic | legendwinner = Winner | legendrunner = Runner Up | legendevic = Evicted | legend5 = Big Boss Winner }} '''''Big Brother Brasil 4''''' was the fourth season of '''''Big Brother Brasil''''' which premiered January 13, 2004 with the season finale airing April 6, 2004 on the [[Rede Globo]] [[television network]]. The show was produced by [[Endemol|Endemol Globo]] and presented by news reporter [[Pedro Bial]] and directed by Jose Bonifacio Brasil de Oliveira. The prize award was R$500,000 without tax allowances. The winner was 21 year-old nanny Gecilda "Cida" dos Santos from [[Mangaratiba]], [[Rio de Janeiro]].[http://bbb.globo.com/BBB4/0,6993,LBL710705-3083-U,00.html Cida Big Sister! BabÃ¡ de Magaratiba Ã© a primeira mulher a vencer o Big Broter Brasil e fatura R$500 mil] She was the first woman to win the show in [[Brasil|Brazil]] and the youngest winner ever. ==Overview== There were fourteen housemates competing for the grand prize. The season lasted 85 days, an increase of one week over the previous season. Housemates Marcela and Solange were involved in what is considered until today the worst fight in all seasons. ===Reunion Show=== The reunion was hosted by [[Pedro Bial]] and aired on April 11, 2004. All the former housemates, attended. Cristiano ended up winning the "Big Boss Prize" which awarded a new [[Fiat Stilo]]. He won over Marcela with 70% of the fans' vote.[http://bbb.globo.com/BBB4/0,6993,LBL712557-3083-U,00.html Roupa suja lavada: Cris derrota Marcela e ganha o carro com 70% dos votos] ===After the Show=== EdÃ­lson Buba died in 2006 due to a stomach cancer. Juliana Lopes starred in a [[Rede Record]]'s prime-time soap opera in 2007 entitled "Vidas Opostas". ==Housemates== (ages stated at time of contest) {| class="wikitable" |- ! Name ! Age ! Occupation ! The Head of Household vote (casted in front of the other housemates) automatically nominate one housemate from eviction. Then, the other housemates voting and if the vote is tied, the HOH breaks the tie (all this types of vote count for the total number of nominations received). {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width: 99%; font-size:87%; line-height:15px;" |- ! rowspan=2| ! rowspan=2| Week 1 ! rowspan=2| Week 2 ! rowspan=2| Week 3 ! rowspan=2| Week 4 ! rowspan=2| {{nowrap|Week 5}} ! rowspan=2| Week 6 ! rowspan=2| Week 7 ! rowspan=2| Week 8 ! rowspan=2| Week 9 ! rowspan=2| {{nowrap|Week 10}} ! rowspan=2| Week 11 ! colspan=2| Week 12 ! rowspan=2| Nominations
